Instruction: Rinse rice in a fine-mesh strainer until water runs clear.
Combine rinsed rice and water in a rice cooker. Cook according to manufacturer's instructions.
While rice cooks, whisk together rice vinegar, sugar, and salt in a small saucepan. Heat over low heat until sugar dissolves. Set aside.
Once rice is cooked, transfer it to a large bowl. Using a wooden spoon, gently fold in the vinegar mixture until evenly distributed.
Let rice cool slightly until it's comfortable to handle (around 100Â°F).
Prepare a small bowl of water and have a sheet of plastic wrap or nori seaweed nearby.
Wet your hands with water to prevent sticking. Scoop about 1/3 cup of rice and gently form it into a ball.
Create a well in the center of the rice ball. Add your chosen filling.
Enclose the filling with remaining rice and shape the ball into a triangle or your desired form.
Dip your hands in water again if needed. Gently wrap a strip of nori around the base of the onigiri (optional).
Sprinkle with furikake seasoning if desired.
Repeat steps 6-11 to form onigiri with remaining rice and fillings.
Serve immediately or wrap individually in plastic wrap for later enjoyment.
